name: Base node. Change ALL URL's to match.
Create a Unordered or Ordered List from a simple input. \n
Create a Description List from a simple input. \n
Create a table from simple input. \n
Chaining test. Outputs from the uib-element node can be sent onwards as long as intermediate nodes retain the msg._ui property \n
HTML Passthrough. Input HTML is wrapped in a DIV \n
Dynamically change the page title, description and 1st H1 tag on the page \n
Dynamically add a row to an existing table \n
Dynamically add a row to an existing list. Update the list style for an entry \n
Dynamically insert an input form with auto-send data to node-red via a button. \n
Extended version of simple template using the ES Module version of the client \n
Create a Description List from a simple array in node. \n Data is specified in the uib-element node instead of externally as an example \n

Add a <div> tag contining some dynamic text, an <hr>, and an <a> tag using uib-tag nodes \n <hr> has no ID so cannot be removed on its own, only via its parent. <a> tag's slot text is defined in the node so no extra change node needed. \n
Dynamically add a button that sends a msg back here using eventSend. \n
Send a msg
info:
Send a simply msg to the front-end.

The default front-end template code will display the msg
using HTML formatting, no coding required.

title: Zero-code examples
descr: A collection of flows that demonstrate and test all of the uib-element node's output types.
info:
This example uses the default blank template.

It does not use any front-end framework, just
pure HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

name: uibuilder standard output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #1 (top) which is
the standard output.

Here you will see any standard msg sent from
your front-end code.

name: uibuilder control output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #2 (bottom) which is
the control output.

Here you will see any control msg either sent
by the node itself or from the front-end library.

For example the "client disconnect" and
"client connect" messages. Or the "visibility"
messages from the client.

Loop the "client connect", "cache replay" and
"cache clear" messages back to a `uib-cache`
node before the input to uibuilder in order
to control the output of the cache.

name: Reload
info:
Sends a pre-formatted msg to the front-end that
causes the page to reload itself.

name: Plain UL/OL List (Array)
payload: ["LI One","LI Two",["LI Three a","LI Three b"],"LI Four"]

name: Plain UL/OL List (Object)
payload: {"L1":"LI One","L2":"LI Two","L3":"LI Three a","L4":["LI Four a","LI Four b"]}

name: Plain DL List (Array)
payload: [["Entry One","Description One"],["Entry Two","Description Two a","Description Two b","Description Two c"],["Entry Three","Description Three"],["Entry Four","Description Four"]]

name: Plain DL List (List of Objects)
payload: [{"Entry 1":"Description 1"},{"Entry 2a":"Description 2a","Entry 2b":"Description 2b - this wont show. Use List not object for multiple Descriptions."},{"Entry 3":["Description 3 a","Description 3 b"]},{"Entry 4":"Description 4"}]

name: Plain DL List (Object of Objects)
payload: {"ONE":{"A":"LI One A"},"TWO":{"B":["LI Two B1","LI Two B2"]},"THREE":{"C":{"C1":"LI Three C1","C2":"LI Three C2"}}}

name:
Limitation: we have to resend everything just to update one thing. 
 Instead, consider using this to create the HTML then copy the HTML using your browser's developer tools 
 then save the HTML into the index.html file. 
 You can still update using a uib-element node with the same ID or you can use a uib-update node as appropriate.

payload: A am a new list entry 😁

name: Add a Form
payload: [{"id":"r1-text","type":"text","required":false,"label":"Text Input:","value":"Foo"},{"id":"r6-email-req","type":"email","title":"You can add your own popup info","required":true,"label":"Email:"},{"id":"r2-color","type":"color","label":"Colour:","value":"#427798"},{"id":"r3-date-req","type":"date","required":true},{"id":"r3-date-month","type":"month","disabled":true},{"id":"r4-range","type":"range","required":false,"label":"Range (0-100):","value":"20","min":0,"max":100},{"id":"r3-file","type":"file"},{"id":"r4-check","label":"Checkbox (true/false):","type":"checkbox","value":"false"},{"id":"r5-check","label":"Checkbox selected (true/false):","type":"checkbox","checked":true},{"id":"r5-textarea","label":"Text area:","type":"textarea","value":"Some text. Sorry, no HTML."},{"id":"r6-select","label":"Select (two):","type":"select","options":[{"label":"Option 1","value":"one"},{"label":"Option 2","value":"two"},{"label":"Option 3"}],"value":"two"},{"id":"r7-select","label":"Select (multi):","type":"select","options":[{"label":"Option 1a","value":"one a"},{"label":"Option 2a","value":"two a"},{"label":"Option 3a","value":"three a"}],"value":"three a","multiple":true}]
info:
Creates an example form showing off different features.

No buttons are included so that the `uib-element` node
automatically creates the two "Send" and "Reset" default
buttons for you.

Email & Data inputs are marked as required but left with
no default value to show the invalid field/form highlights.

name: Zero-Code Examples. Flows for all uib-element types

info:
This example uses a blank template with
the ESM build of the front-end client.

It does not use any front-end framework, just
pure HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

The ESM build should be included using an
`import` statement in your `index.js` file.

ESM = ECMA Script Module.

name: Send a msg
info:
Send a simply msg to the front-end.

The default front-end template code will display the msg
using HTML formatting, no coding required.

name: Reload
info:
Sends a pre-formatted msg to the front-end that
causes the page to reload itself.

name: uibuilder standard output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #1 (top) which is
the standard output.

Here you will see any standard msg sent from
your front-end code.

name: uibuilder control output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #2 (bottom) which is
the control output.

Here you will see any control msg either sent
by the node itself or from the front-end library.

For example the "client disconnect" and
"client connect" messages. Or the "visibility"
messages from the client.

Loop the "client connect", "cache replay" and
"cache clear" messages back to a `uib-cache`
node before the input to uibuilder in order
to control the output of the cache.

name: Toggle Visible Msgs
info:
Change the "prop" value to a CSS Selector.

The display will appear as the last child of
that selected element.

e.g. `body` or `#more`.

props.v:
[{"method":"replace","components":[{"type":"div","id":"md","parent":"#more","attributes":{},"slotMarkdown":"## H2 - Markdown input

Some text in a para

* List #1
* List #2
"}]}]

data: [["Entry One","Description One"],["Entry Two","Description Two a","Description Two b","Description Two c"],["Entry Three","Description Three"],["Entry Four","Description Four"]]

name: uib-tag example - similar to uib-element but adds/replaces a single HTML or web component element (tag)
